description.b: ASSET uses a workspace to contain your data. Data in this workspace is stored in Project folders. In this cheat sheet we'll be creating these placeholders, then we'll include a link to the ASSET tutorial scenarios

item.title: Configure your cheat sheet
item.description: Well, before we get started configuring ASSET, let's take the small step of configuring this cheat sheet. I expect this panel is vertically split into two equally sized sections: the tree structure in the top-half, and this text in the lower. It will be easier to view these steps if you give them a little more space - so grab the blue separator bar and drag it up a little, ta-da! Well done.

item.title: Open the navigator
item.description: The Navigator window is your view of your data files. It should be visible at the top-left of ASSET. If it isn't, then open it via opening the Window menu and selecting Show View/Navigator, or by using 'Click to perform' below.

item.title: Check you have a project
item.description: When first opened, workspaces are typically empty. You create a project that contains either your data files, or a number of links to existing data. So, have a look in your Navigator and see if there are any folders (projects) listed there.

item.title: Create a 'General' project
item.description: If your navigator is empty, then yes, you need to create a project. Right-click in the Navigator view, and select 'New', then 'Project...'. The New Project wizard will open. From the 'General' folder, select Project, and then press 'Next'. Now just enter a name for your project (this could be your name or the name of the current simulation project). Lastly press the 'Finish' button, and you will see the new project in your workspace. Or use the 'Click to run' link below to quickly open the New project window.

item.title: Link to the sample data
item.description: Right-click on your current project in the Navigator view, then select Folder from the New sub-menu. The New Folder wizard will open. Instead of creating a fresh child folder to store our data, we're going to link to an existing folder. So, whilst still in the New Folder Wizard, click the 'Advanced' button to display the Advanced options. Next, click on the 'Link to alternate location (Linked folder)', and click on 'Browse...' to navigate to the 'AssetData' subfolder in your AssetNG installation folder on your machine or the network, clicking on Finish to, erm, Finish.

item.title: Check the XML editor is configured
item.description:
ASSET uses data files that adhere to the XML data standard. XML is easily read and manipulated by computers, but can be a little verbose and fiddly when edited by humans. That's why we use an XML Editor that hides some of the fiddly details
ASSET is based on the Eclipse platform, which includes its own rudimentary xml editor. Check this is present by expanding the sample data folder in your Navigator. Now right-click on an xml file. In the "Open With" sub-menu you should see "XML Editor", this confirms the xml editor is present and working. If you don't see the XML Editor entry, please contact the mainainer - since it appears your installation is invalid, and you won't be getting much further with this tutorial.
